title: Withdrew United States from World Health Organization (Again)
summary: Trump signed Executive Order 14155 on his first day in office (January 20, 2025), withdrawing the United States from the World Health Organization for the second time. After the required one-year notice period, the U.S. formally exited WHO on January 22, 2026. All U.S. funding to WHO was terminated, and U.S. personnel were recalled from WHO headquarters and offices worldwide. This was the second withdrawal attempt - Trump began withdrawal in July 2020 during his first presidency, but Biden reversed it in January 2021. Experts warned the withdrawal would hamper global response to disease outbreaks.
keyFacts: January 20, 2025: Trump signed Executive Order 14155 withdrawing from WHO on his first day of second term
January 22, 2026: United States formally exited WHO after one-year notice period
Second time Trump withdrew from WHO - first attempt was July 2020, reversed by Biden in January 2021
All U.S. government funding to WHO terminated
U.S. personnel and contractors recalled from WHO headquarters in Geneva and worldwide offices
Trump cited WHO's handling of COVID-19 pandemic and 'lack of accountability, transparency, and independence'
Claimed U.S. payments were 'unfairly onerous' compared to other countries
Noted China contributes nearly 90% less than U.S. despite having a population more than 4 times larger
Argentina announced it would also withdraw from WHO in February 2025, following Trump's lead
Johns Hopkins experts warned withdrawal would hamper global response to outbreaks
U.S. was WHO's largest single donor before withdrawal
